page.title: 06ECOLOGY 2
page.content: Field boundaries are mainly hedgerows. A recent disturbing trend is the removal of some to increase field sizes. At Parduvine, the farmer has cut a hedge down to ground level. The shadow it cast delayed the ripening of the crop by several weeks. Also he wants to straighten the stream beside this hedge to lessen the risk of flooding. There is a large amount of wildlife including Roe Deer,Rabbits,Hares and the usual wild birds such as Chaffinches,Sparrows and Owls about. Many game birds are to be seen, such as Pheasant and Grouse.
